content.description:
The leftmost bolted route on The South Buttress, this climb starts simply but with a fun reachy move, and moves into 4 dihedral roof things that reminded me of the miniture version of Killer Bee (5.10c, Center Wall).

Climbing is sustained after the third bolt, but interesting and excellent rests are around for the creative. The crux is pulling through the 3rd dihedral roof thing, which is at the fifth - sixth bolt.
content.protection: 7 bolts to a 2 bolt top anchor.

content.description:
Junk Food Junkie is a strange climb.  It is very easy to notice it some 60 feet right of 7-11 burrito.

The entire route is pretty sustained, but the crux is what makes the climb noteworthy.  It is near the 3rd bolt, and is a well-protected dihedral/roof section that really doesn't have much on the way of hands.
content.protection: 9 bolts to a 2 bolt anchor.  Bring a sling for the 3rd bolt.

content.description:
This is the easiest bolted route on the South Buttress. It's the last set of bolts on the far right of the cliffband.

Climb up to the first bolt, which is about 20 feet off the deck on easy climbing, and then move over a series of bulges to the top anchors.  The crux is getting over the final bulge, and is well protected by the third bolt.

Don't fall on the 5.5 climbing below the first bolt.
content.protection: 3 bolts to a 2 bolt top anchor.  It is probably possible to top rope this route by walking around to the top anchors.

content.description:
7-11 Burrito is easily recognized by the undercling/lieback moves required for the first couple of bolts.  It is near the center of the South Buttress cliff band, though only the second bolted route from the left.

After moving up and left past the first two bolts, the climbing gets easy for another 2 bolts until you have to pull the strange crux roof.  After that continue up a less steep face for another few bolts before finishing on a slightly steeper face.
